reviews.review_msg: Chem 215 is a poorly structed course to begin with. Dev makes it far worse as every lab is essentially 5 hours of work for the lab reports OUTSIDE of the 4 hour lab time every week, plus readings, pop quizzes, lon capa, and a final. Trash professor who is well past his time teaching, can't even understand half of what he says.
Kind, caring professor! He looks intimidating at first, but once you interact with him during the labs, etc... you'll realize that he's pretty cool and willing to help you as much as possible.

He can be pretty intense and talk down to you when you ask him questions, but when he's in a good mood he is a fantastic lab instructor. If you show interest and ask him questions about most things out of the lab, he is truly caring and will give you a very detailed and thoughtful answer.

He cares about his students and takes the time to explain things clearly. However, the lab manual is not the best quality since the procedures haven't been updated and there are a lot of grammatical errors. A lot of work required for lab write-ups too.
